DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Agent Transfer Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Frequency Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is an action in which an authorized party at a designated study site dispenses or receives a study agent to/from a study subject, though as a defined activity, no actual study subject is identified. EXAMPLE(S): Dispensing a bottle of pills A coded value specifying the number of occurrences of an activity within a given time period. EXAMPLE(S): BID = Two times per day, at unspecified times (does not necessarily imply that these are 12 hours apart); Q12H = Every twelve hours

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Agent Transfer Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Frequency Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Make or do or perform again.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.
The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
